snippet: If Congress is to defuse a budgetary time bomb, the forces of conciliation will have to become far more organized than the bipartisan opposition.
abstract: Congress faces difficulties in defusing the budgetary time bomb before Jan 2013, when nearly $8 trillion in tax increases and automatic spending cuts go into force, spelling potential disaster for the delicate economy; Bowles-Simpson deficit plan is regarded by the Washington cognoscenti as the compromise the Democrats and Republicans will have to eventually accept before the end of 2012.
lead_paragraph: If Congress is to defuse a budgetary time bomb, the forces of conciliation will have to become far more organized than the bipartisan opposition.

headline.seo: Budget Plan’s Defeat Shows Hurdles to Compromise
headline.main: Budget Plan’s Defeat Shows Hurdles to Compromise
headline.print_headline: Budget Plan’s Defeat Shows Hurdles to Compromise
